column4: after dist upgrade my dpkg status file is corrupt. How can I fix that?
i think u can do that by going to recovery mode
thing is, there is only some descrption of a package broken
this command comes to mind dpkg-reconfigure
does this actually fix the problem of there being a corrupt package status file?
so the reason for the problems was an empty line in a package description.
so if that goes for the total package broken, then yes
maybe you can do a apt-cache show mirthkit and see if there is a new line in the description?
how would you check for newline like that? you def need  some  extra commands in there
sure, but a plain old regular expression should be enough
in fact it is only this line that is necessary pcregrep -nM '\n\s*\n[^P]+' /var/lib/dpkg/status
and I think this could be done in sed as well
this seems to be something for lintian, doesn't it? (if it is not already checked in there)
probably yes , it is definitely a weird issue which im sure others have had or have and dont know they have it
lintian seems to check for this errors
lintian catches the error definitely. I tried it here.
